title: Mott The Hoople: Fairfield Halls, Live 1970 (2007)
description:
Regarded by fans as a classic lost performance, this shelved live set recorded in support of a Free show runs to seven tracks, bolstered by a handful of cuts from Stockholm in 1971.

Ã¢â‚¬ËœFairfield Halls, Live 1970Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ captures the full concert, from the tumultuous opening "Ohio," all ragged guitars and Verden Allen's foreboding organ, through a dynamite "Rock and Roll Queen" and three slabs from the then-forthcoming Ã¢â‚¬ËœMad ShadowsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, and on to the closing oldies, "Keep a Knockin'" and "You Really Got Me."

Five tracks recorded five months later in Sweden repeat "Thunderbuck Ram" but do add "Walkin' with a Mountain," "Laugh at Me," and "The Original Mixed-Up Kid" to the brew, plus a volcanic cover of Mountain's "Long Red" that will leave you reeling. As if the rest of the disc hasn't already battered you hard enough.



Mott The Hoople

Fairfield Halls, Live 1970

2007
